result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaac Scott Schilling

records.addlTxt: Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on September 15, 2023 at 08:30 am.

3:04 PM Defendant Isaac Scott Schilling in court.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Isaac Scott Schilling.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

21CF8, 21CF324, 22CF255, 22TR4121

State - there is an agreement, deft will enter plea to Ct 2 in 21CF8, Ct 2 in 21CF324, and Ct 1 in 22CF255 - all other counts to be dismissed and read-in, 22TR4121 to be dismissed
   1 year probation for 21CF8 and 21CF324
          Probation conditions: no contact with SAC 8/23/85, DFZ 1/4/71, JREZ 10/15/67, and BAS 10/7/05 - Court costs of $463 on each count - follow recommendations of agent
   12 month DAGP for 22CF255

Defendant - enters a no contest plea to Ct 2 in 21CF8, enters a no contest plea to Ct 2 in 21CF324, and enters a no contest plea to Ct 1 in 22CF255 , waives rights & JT
Parties stip that facts support the plea.

Court - finds waiver of rights & plea voluntary, free & knowing & approves stip by parties to facts
Accepts no contest pleas to Ct 2 in 21CF8 and Ct 2 in 21CF324  and finds defendant guilty
Does not accept no contest plea to Ct 1 in 22CF255 and approves DAGP for 12 months

State - believes the joint recommendation is appropriate and asks Court to adopt
Atty Petersen - makes statement to the Court, also asks Court to adopt joint recommendation
Deft - makes statement to the Court

Court Orders - 
Count 2 in 21CF8 - sentence withheld, 12 months probation
  - No contact with SAC 8/23/85, DFZ 1/4/71, JREZ 10/15/67, and BAS 10/7/05
  - Pay court costs of $463
  - Follow recommendations of agent

Count 2 in 21CF324 - sentence withheld, 12 months probation
  - No contact with SAC 8/23/85, DFZ 1/4/71, JREZ 10/15/67, and BAS 10/7/05
  - Pay court costs of $463
  - Follow recommendations of agent

Count 1 in 22CF255
  - Approves DAGP for 12 months
  - DAGP review scheduled for 9/15/23 at 8:30am

Dismissed and read-in: Ct 1 in 21CF8, Ct 1 in 21CF324, and Cts 2 and 3 in 22CF255
Dismissed: 22TR4121
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

10:13 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas D Arras in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaac Scott Schilling in court.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko in court for Isaac Scott Schilling. B. Bahr - Clerk 
State - asks court to take judicial notice of bond in Dunn 21CF324
Court - takes judicial notice of bond in Dunn 21CF324
10:15 AM State - calls Deputy Greg Moen. Witness is sworn in and testifies. Witness identifies defendant.
10:20 AM Atty Yonko - cross examines witness
10:21 AM witness excused
Parties have no further witnesses or evidence
State - argues for Court to find probable cause
Atty Yonko - argues State has not met its burden
Court - finds probable cause and binds DE over. Sets ARGN 22TR4121 to tag along
Arraignment scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

The original document was titled: State's Victim Identification Key
The original history event date is: 07-26-2022
records.descr: Order on motion to seal/redact court record

records.addlTxt: on Motion Seal Redact Court Record

1:19 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaac Scott Schilling appeared by video.  Attorney Richard Louis Yonko appeared by video for Isaac Scott Schilling. Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appears by Zoom. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CF255, 21CF324

22CF255 - INIT w/Attorney Shelly Tomtschik appearing on behalf of DE
Atty Tomtschik - rcvd complaint, waive reading
State - asking $1,000 cash bond. No contact with BAS dob: 10/7/05.
Atty Tomtschik - no objection to no contact. Asks for sign bond.
Court - orders $350 cash bond. No contact with BAS dob: 10/7/05.
Atty Tomtschik - asking for speedy prelim.
Court - sets prelim for August 1, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

21CF324 - Bond Hearing w/Attorney Yonko appearing on behalf of DE
Atty Yonko - rcvd Bond modification request. Argues against bond request. 
State - asks court to modify $1,000 sign bond to a $500 cash bond.
Atty Yonko - argues for high sign bond.
Court - modifies bond from $1,000 sign bond to $100 cash bond
